title.narrative: KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT

description.narrative: By 2016, policy makers, society, media, families, children and adolescents have access to improved knowledge on the situation of children and adolescents, including disaggregated data (by gender, race, age, geographic location), evidence on major inequality factors and monitoring data in emergency situations, which they can use to provide and/or demand actions that contribute to the realisation of children's rights., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, governments at national and sub-national levels, media, corporate sector and civil society with increased capacities and knowledge on the most disadvantaged children, contributing to the universalization of Child Rights, supporting specific public policies addressing inequities and prioritizing boys and girls in public budgets.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, policy makers, society, media, families, children and adolescents have access to improved knowledge on the situation ofchildren and adolescents, including disaggregated data (by gender, race, age, geographic location), evidence on major inequalityfactors and monitoring data in emergency situations, which they can use to provide and/or demand actions that contribute to therealisation of children's rights.

description.narrative: In 2016, MXE focused on: i) new CP, where knowledge management played a key role; ii) data analysis for UNICEF Seal and PCU; iii) response to Aedes aegypty and Zika; iv) support to capacity development in equity-focused MXE and data analysis; v) dissemination of knowledge on children&39;s rights in Brazil. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Number of studies, research and surveys generating improved data in key areas to tackle inequalities (e.g. out of school children, HIV/AIDS, violence, adolescent participation, etc.)

actual.value: 2016:Two studies completed in 2016: - Qualitative study series on knowledge, attitude and practices related to Zika virus and Aedes aegypti, - Qualitative analysis of determinants for adolescent pregnancy.

title.narrative: Number of knowledge products created or updated by UNICEF to facilitate access to and use of up-to-date, disaggregated data on the situation of children and adolescents and on inequalities

target.value: 2016:1 new product or update per year

actual.value: 2016:Achieved. Three knowledge products completed in 2016: - Situation Analysis of Brazilian Children and Adolescents, - Chapter on The Girl Child: a situation of progress and challenges for girls in Brazil 20 years after Beijing, - Data sets: final indicator and inequality reduction analysis for ei

title.narrative: Number of programmes, products and initiatives developed by partners with UNICEF's support, related to the improvement of disaggregated data, particularly on inequalities, including emergency monitoring systems.

baseline.value: Contributions are offered on a regular basis

actual.value: 2016:2 programmes/initiatives: - Disability data collection: helping IBGE adequate to international standards, - Birth registration: support to partners' initiative to measure and eradicate under-registration, especially among indigenous children,

title.narrative: Existence of an integrated knowledge management strategy in UNICEF Brazil, in line with the country's needs and with the UN community
